image.altText: SUV with bullet holes

props.synopsis: Police say tactical officers foiled an alleged planned hit near a day care centre in Revesby in Sydney's south-west on Tuesday afternoon.

title.children: 'Collateral damage' avoided as NSW Police foil alleged hit near day care

image.altText: Sunset behind mining operation, candy cane coloured chimney

props.synopsis: The last Australian copper smelter processing third-party product will stay open after its owner accepted a support package.

title.children: Mining giant gets $600m worth of taxpayer funds to keep refinery open

image.altText: blue Optus signage outside an office on Lyonmark Road

props.synopsis: The communications department did not find out about the Optus outage for more than a day after it occurred because an email was sent to the wrong address, Senate estimates has heard. Follow live.

title.children: Email detailing Optus triple-0 outage sent to wrong government mailbox

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Communications minister's office copied into Optus triple zero emails
Lawrence Wong says Singapore expects Singtel to act responsibly
Albanese says it will be 'important' for Australia to have access to Singapore's ports

image.altText: The Victoria Police insignia on the sleeve of an officer's shirt.

props.synopsis: Police are alerting hundreds of accused sexual offenders that their cases may be compromised by the work of a digital forensics officer based in Bendigo.

title.children: Hundreds of Victorian sex crime cases being re-examined by police

image.altText: A woman looks distressed on a video call.

props.synopsis: An Australian activist accuses the federal government of not providing enough support after she and other members of a flotilla were detained by Israel.

title.children: Australian flotilla activist speaks after being detained by Israel

image.altText: Andreas Slavkos at his graduation.

props.synopsis: Students have been left with HECS debts and careers that are "non-existent" after completing degrees that were not accredited. Class actions have been launched against two Australian universities.

title.children: Careers in limbo after graduates discover university courses were never accredited

image.altText: A wide shot of mass destruction, rubble and a large grey smoke plume over a horizon.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump insists the United States will "do everything possible" to prevent Israel restarting the war in Gaza, in the event Hamas agrees to a peace deal.

title.children: US to 'do everything possible' to prevent war if Hamas agrees to peace deal

image.altText: A long line of people hiking on a snow-covered mountain.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of trekkers, villagers and support staff have safely reached the Tibetan town of Qudang, according to Chinese state media.

title.children: More than 500 hikers reportedly rescued from Mount Everest

image.altText: An illustration of Google search on a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: One year on from the rollout of Google AI Overviews in Australia, exclusive data shows steep year-on-year declines in readership for the top news websites as smaller publishers warn of lay-offs.

title.children: Fears of online journalism Armageddon as Google changes the game

image.altText: A sign that says "for lease".

props.synopsis: Median rental prices have risen to more than $700 per week for the first time, according to Cotality's Quarterly Rental Review.

title.children: Increasing rent driving people away from employment

image.altText: Christian Petracca playing for the Demons.

props.synopsis: Gold Coast secures a first-round pick from St Kilda in exchange for Sam Flanders, which could open the doors to a deal being done with Melbourne for Christian Petracca. Follow live.

title.children: Suns close in on Petracca deal after nabbing prized draft pick

image.altText: John Noh speaks into a microphone at a wood desk.

props.synopsis: The AUKUS submarine pact may need "commonsense" action from both Australia and the US to make it more "sustainable", according to Donald Trump's nominee to oversee US defence strategy in the Indo-Pacific.

title.children: Trump's Pentagon nominee flags possible 'commonsense' AUKUS changes

image.altText: A blonde woman casts a sideways look at Donald Trump.

props.synopsis: US Attorney-General Pam Bondi has faced heated questioning from senators over claims she's transforming the justice department into a "shield for the president and his political allies".

title.children: US attorney-general accused of using justice system to protect Trump

image.altText: A woman in a dark hijab smiles as she holds a toddler in her arms on a beach.

props.synopsis: Children in Gaza are experiencing grief, loss, displacement, and starvation. For some, this is all they know or remember.

title.children: 'He doesn't feel like a normal child': War's toll on Gaza's babies

image.altText: Gold bullion stacking up.

props.synopsis: The price of gold has hit another record and is set to become Australia's second most valuable resource export after iron ore.

title.children: Gold prices surge as investors watch 'extraordinary global scenario'

image.altText: Chelsea FC Women star Sam Kerr stands on the pitch smiling widely after a win.

props.synopsis: Sam Kerr's two year absence from the Matildas is almost over, she's set to feature in friendlies later this month, while Mary Fowler is recovering well from her own ACL injury.

title.children: Kerr finally set for Matildas return, Fowler on track for Asian Cup

image.altText: An orange round circle with the shadow of a tree on them and a black background

props.synopsis: Stargazers from around the world have captured the luminous glow of October's supermoon.

title.children: Stunning photos as supermoon season begins

image.altText: A white woman with long brown hair and glasses standing in a kitchen

props.synopsis: A year after a controversial NDIS change, advocates are growing increasingly concerned that "counterintuitive" and "nonsensical" funding decisions are reducing participant independence.

title.children: 'I was so cross': NDIS participants blast 'nonsensical' spending rules

image.altText: Giant screen on the wall of the ASX, with large green numbers, showing the price of shares which have risen.

props.synopsis: The Australian dollar surges against the Japanese yen on speculation its central bank will delay lifting interest rates, while the ASX 200 begins its day with a slight fall and the gold price surges above $US4,000 an ounce. Follow live.

title.children: Aussie dollar jumps to 10-month high against Japanese yen

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Bluescope boss calls for cheaper gas prices
Bluescope boss calls for cheaper gas prices
Glencore says bailout is a short-term lifeline

image.altText: Young people sit at a wooden table conversing with each other under dance floor lights.

props.synopsis: When the dating app radius won't reach the edge of your property, and you're harvesting grain from sun-up til sundown, how do you find a partner?

title.children: Speed dating a solution to the slow dating lives of farmers

image.altText: A headshot of Taylor Swift with jewels and feathers surrounding her head

props.synopsis: Founder and designer Paul Vasileff says he's grateful to have his Adelaide-made couture dress on the world stage with pop superstar Taylor Swift wearing it in the new The Fate of Ophelia music video.

title.children: Taylor Swift shines in Australian-designed dress in lead single

image.altText: Donald Trump sits in a blue suit and white shirt speaking to someone out of frame.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump has made no secret that he wants to win this year's Nobel Peace Prize. Here's why experts say it's unlikely he'll win the prestigious award.

title.children: Will Trump win the Nobel Peace Prize?

image.altText: Minjee Lee looks to one side

props.synopsis: Australian superstar Minjee Lee is in line for several big awards as the 2025 golf season enters the home stretch in Asia.

title.children: Minjee Lee chases more prizes in Asian golf swing

image.altText: A saltwater crocodile leaning up against a muddy brown bank, with black zip-ties around it's mouth.

props.synopsis: The discovery of a saltwater crocodile with its mouth bound shut by zip ties in a Darwin river has sparked outrage, with animal rights advocates calling for stronger wildlife protections.

title.children: Saltwater crocodile found with mouth zip-tied shut near Darwin

image.altText: A wide shot of man in running clothes.

props.synopsis: Two men have smashed the record for completing one of the world's longest walking tracks in the fastest time, within days of each other.

title.children: Bibbulmun Track record broken twice in one week

image.altText: Mobile phone betting apps generic

props.synopsis: The NT government is standing by its de-facto regulation of Australia’s $50 billion online gambling industry, despite allegations that it is too closely linked to the sector.

title.children: Calls for national gambling watchdog grow after NT regulator accusations

image.altText: A disability facility in suburban Adelaide.

props.synopsis: A South Australian government aged care home, which looks after 23 people with dementia or complex disabilities, inappropriately used lap belts and other mechanical restraints to stop falls and control residents' behaviour, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: 'It's a human rights tragedy': Aged care facility inappropriately restrained residents

image.altText: A photo of books laid out, their covers overlapping

props.synopsis: Research shows Australians are reading fewer books than ever before. One writer shares her advice on how to make reading a daily habit.

title.children: I've read 63 books so far this year. Here's how I did it

image.altText: A dump truck drives along red dirt near a mine

props.synopsis: Australia's two biggest iron ore miners continue to expand their operations in WA's Pilbara, despite warnings of waning demand.

title.children: Iron ore mining shows no signs of slowing despite price drop concerns

image.altText: Flames at the blast furnace at Whyalla's steelworks.

props.synopsis: A future made in Australia? Not if gas prices keep rising, major manufacturers warn as they call for urgent action to secure affordable supply.

title.children: Industry warns 'no gas, no future' amid high prices and falling demand

image.altText: a man in a yellow jumper looking at rubble

props.synopsis: Residents who lost their homes in a blaze that ripped through WA's southern wheatbelt in January may have to wait more than two years to seek compensation.

title.children: Widower living in bus as he waits for answers on fire that destroyed home

image.altText: A woman in police uniform at a press conference.

props.synopsis: In a wide-ranging interview as she begins as AFP commissioner, Krissy Barrett announces a new sub-terror strike force, and flags that newly written hate crime laws may need to be strengthened further.

title.children: New AFP boss warns hate crime laws may need to be strengthened further

image.altText: Anika Wells leafs through papers in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: The adequacy of Australia's emergency call network will be stress tested with a surprise drill ahead of bushfire season, as the opposition ramps up its assault over the communication minister's handling of last month's fatal triple-0 outage.

title.children: Telcos face surprise 'stress test' within weeks as Optus fallout continues

image.altText: A mockup of an architecturally designed building that incorporates gold cladding and lots of windows

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory treasurer says the federal government will not support the proposed Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander art gallery in Alice Springs in its current form.

title.children: Federal support for national Aboriginal art gallery in Alice Springs in doubt
